## âš¡ Workflow Overview & Setup

**Summary:** This workflow automatically converts dense white papers (from URLs or PDFs) into engaging social media content. It scrapes the text, uses AI to generate a LinkedIn carousel script and a blog post, creates a PDF of the carousel, and updates a Google Sheet with the assets.

### Requirements
* **Credentials:** BrowserAct, OpenRouter (GPT-4), Google Sheets, APITemplate.io, Slack.
* **Mandatory:** BrowserAct API (Template: **White Paper to Social Media Converter**)

### How to Use
1.  **Credentials:** Set up API keys for all services.
2.  **BrowserAct Template:** Ensure the **White Paper to Social Media Converter** template is active.
3.  **Google Sheet:** Prepare a sheet with a `Target Page Url` column.
4.  **APITemplate.io:** Create a PDF template for the carousel slides.
5.  **Execution:** Trigger manually to process the list.

### Need Help?
[How to Find Your BrowserAct API Key & Workflow ID](https://docs.browseract.com)
[How to Connect n8n to BrowserAct](https://docs.browseract.com)
[How to Use & Customize BrowserAct Templates](https://docs.browseract.com)

### ðŸ“¥ Step 1: Input & Scraping

The workflow reads a list of white paper URLs from Google Sheets. BrowserAct then navigates to each link and extracts the full text content, handling PDF viewers or web pages automatically.

### ðŸŽ¨ Step 2: Asset Generation

An AI analyzes the scraped text. It simultaneously drafts:

1.  A viral-style LinkedIn post with a 5-slide carousel script.
2.  A comprehensive, HTML-formatted blog post summarizing the white paper. 

The carousel script is sent to APITemplate.io to generate a professional PDF document ready for LinkedIn upload. This PDF link, along with the blog post HTML, is saved back to the Google Sheet
